No building shall be erected, altered or used nor
shall any premises be used for any purpose other than those set forth
in this section.

No building permit shall be issued for any use permitted
in an R-7 District unless the applicant has first obtained building
plan and site plan approval as required by law.
Permitted principal uses shall be limited to the following:

Noncommercial membership clubs, subject to the requirements
applicable in an R-1 District and with the permission of the Board
of Trustees.[Amended 6-28-1995 by L.L. No. 6-1995]

Residential attached cluster dwelling units conforming
to a total average density of no more than seven units per acre.

Residential cluster dwelling units shall conform to
the following regulations:

Existing structures may be incorporated into the overall
design.
The minimum area of the site shall be 10 acres.

Every dwelling unit shall have pedestrian access to
a street, court, walkway or equivalent, designed for public use.

At least 40% of the total area of the lot shall be
open space.

No building may contain more than seven dwelling units,
except that the Planning Board may permit buildings to contain eight
units where a site plan is being approved pursuant to applicable law.

The minimum floor area of each unit shall be 875 square
feet.

The front yard setback of each building shall be at
least 25 feet.

The maximum height of each building shall be 2 1/2
stories or 30 feet.

The maximum building coverage shall be 25% of the
site.

The minimum distance between buildings shall
be 30 feet.

Off-street parking shall be at least three spaces
per dwelling unit, of which at least two shall be enclosed.

No structures or accessory use shall be located
in a front yard.

Accessory uses shall be limited to those uses
permitted in an R-1 District.

Deed restrictions, in a form approved by the
Village Attorney, shall be recorded as to all open space and amenities
to require such spaces to remain open space and not to be further
subdivided.
